label: Portion of a will by Thomas Drayton[?], unsigned, undated
description: A portion of a will possibly belonging to Thomas Drayton in which Drayton specifies the ways in which he would like his slaves distributed. The writer also wills several "hacks" and tracts of land on the Ashley River.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Divide all my Negroes in to four parcels.
W.H. to draw the first. Maria the next
Caro the third. Emma the fourth—
the [Aurbands?] to have nothing to do with
the monies [illegible] from The work of the
Negroes; nor are they or the monies away
from their work subject to his can [hold?]
his debts. It is only for the use of my daug
and her Children for their Maintenance and
clothing and Education of her Children—
until the Mothers death—then as they
[illegible] at the Age of 21 years to take their
proportion of the Negroes and Monies
that may be made by then work—what
[illegible] there are more than to pay all
their [maintenance?] Clothg [Clothing] and Education
the balance to be first to Interest pay
able quarterly and that Interest add
to the principal quarterly—
My sons share of the Negroe, he is to have the
use of land the monies [illegible] for their work
to his use during his life and he is to have
the use of my Pecan plantation with the
three adjoining teach of Land during his life
he is not to have out any part of the Land or
Negroes but to work them himself—Or [illegible]

[End page 1]

Negroes or Land [hand?] out, no Care or attention
is [illegible] to the Negroes when such and the
Land is [ingreed?] by Neglect or [War time?]

I gave a Bond on the Marriage of my Daughter
to Mr. J. Grimke- if he will give up that Bond
I will give her Son Tho. [Thomas] Grimke- My Ashley River
hack called Magnolia- the hack I purchasd [purchased]
of the Estate of [Rose?] called Bear Swamp and
the hack I purchasd [purchased] of Isaac [Perry?]- formerly
Mr [Ladrous?] adjoining my Magnolia hack
and Land of John J. Pringle on Ashley River
also my [illegible] trades that is all [illegible]
I will also give to [him?]
Lands on Ashley River of [illegible] to [illegible] of Age
Son John Grimke my Ocean Plantation [illegible]
the Prize tracts of Land Adjoining the Ocean
Plantation to him if he [illegible] to 21 years for [illegible]
that is I will give his Son Thos [Thomas] the choice
of either the Lands I have Mention on Ashley
River Saint Andrews parish- or the Ocean
Plantation with the three adjoining Tracts
which [illegible] he takes John will then take
the Other. My daughters to have the use of
the NEgroes they [illegible] during their lives, if
they Marry and leave Children that [live?]
to Age 24 ys [years] they may leave the Negroes as
they like and to their Children if any dies before 21 ys [years]
but if they have no Children their
[illegible] have left of [illegible] belong the others
They must leave the Negroes to any of their Sisters
Children they choose- but they are not to
sell a Negroe- All my Lands that I [purchased?]
at the Sales of the Master in Equity W. H. Gett[illegible]

[End page 2]

by order of the Court of Equity to pay my fathers
debts etcetera. [Laying?] and [buy?] in [illegible]
Swamp in St. Prince William and St.
Luke's Parishes- I leave to work the hands of
my daughters- Maria- Caroline, and Emma
when the Children of Caroline arrive at 21
years of Age the lands to be divided between
them- and the [illegible] of Negroes that my Son
draws- who [divid?/divide] between them after the
death of my Son WHD.

Should Mr Grimke [illegible] to give up the Bond
I gave on his Marriage- I then in that [illegible]
the Ocean and the three tracts adjoining- to one of
Carolines sons- and Magnolia Bear Swap
and Mr Ladons to the Other of Carolines Sons
should they arrive at 21 yr [years] of age- but if only
[I leave?] the choice of one of the tract to him
one or none Arrive at 21 yr. [years] of age then I 
order the whole of my Lands to be sold
and the money arising from the Sales of the Lands
to be equally divided between all my Grand Child[ren?]
except Mr Grimkes Children as I have always
given them more than any of my Other Grand
Children by the Bond their father holds of mine
As my Places; on Ashley River will go to [illegible]
I leave the use of them to my daughter Sally.
during her life to take her Children to for their
health and amusement. [Illegible]
[illegible]
[illegible] repair for the use of them- but no [illegible]
on Saint plantation Magnolia
wood or sale of wood [illegible] mad by her

[End page 3]

My Estate to be kept together till all
my Just debts are paid- my daughters
having an [Main?] [illegible] out of it that is
Maria, Caroline, Emma. when all the
debts are paid then the Estate to be divd [divided]
as ordered- My Tract of Land called
the Oake in St. Pauls parish and a hack
in St. Georges Parish at the head of Ashley
River I order to be sold to pay my
debts. also my share of the [douse?] in
Charleston Town to be sold to pay my debts.
should Mr Grimke acceed to my Offer about
the Bond in that care I have all my
Lands in [Coosawhatchee?] Swamp, to be [Divided?]
between Mr [Homers] Children and Emmas should
she marry and have Children

I leave to my Brother in Law Thos. [Thomas] Wilson
the liberty of Residing on my R[illegible] [plat?]
and the use of as much land both high and
low Land as the Negroes I have herewith left
him the use of during his Natural Life can
plant 

[End page 4]
